transcript.speaker: Sarah (PM)
transcript.text: Thanks for pulling this up, David. Let’s focus on the "Dashboard" view today. We need to lock in the widget functionalities so Mike can start the component architecture.

transcript.speaker: David (Design)
transcript.text: Sure. As you can see, I’ve moved to a two-column layout for the main content area, with the persistent sidebar on the left. We went with the dark theme for the sidebar to separate navigation from the data layer.

transcript.speaker: Mike (Eng)
transcript.text: I see the sidebar items: Dashboard, Directory, Documents... Quick question on the "Ask Nexus AI" item. Is that a modal or a separate page?

transcript.speaker: Sarah (PM)
transcript.text: That’s a separate chat interface page. For this dashboard view, just treat it as a navigation link. But let's look at the top row metrics.

transcript.speaker: David (Design)
transcript.text: Right. Three key cards: Total Employees, Upcoming Events, and Open Roles. I wanted these to be "at-a-glance" stats.

transcript.speaker: Mike (Eng)
transcript.text: The "Total Employees" card has a trend indicator (+12% from last month). Is that calculation happening on the backend, or do I need to fetch historical data and calculate it on the client?

transcript.speaker: Sarah (PM)
transcript.text: Backend should send the delta. Just display the green text if it's positive.

transcript.speaker: Mike (Eng)
transcript.text: Got it. And for "Upcoming Events," the mockup shows "Next: Town Hall (Tomorrow)." What happens if there are no events?

transcript.speaker: David (Design)
transcript.text: Good catch. We need an empty state there. Maybe just "No upcoming events" in grey. But usually, there's always something.

transcript.speaker: Sarah (PM)
transcript.text: Let's move to the charts. The "Company Performance (Revenue)" bar chart—David, are we sure we want to show revenue figures this explicitly to all employees?

transcript.speaker: David (Design)
transcript.text: I thought the goal was radical transparency? It visualizes the monthly revenue from Jan to July.

transcript.speaker: Mike (Eng)
transcript.text: I can use a standard charting library for this, likely Recharts or Chart.js. I see hover states aren't shown, but I assume hovering over a bar (like "Feb") should show the exact dollar amount?

transcript.speaker: David (Design)
transcript.text: Exactly. Tooltips are mandatory there.

transcript.speaker: Sarah (PM)
transcript.text: Okay, let's keep the revenue chart for now. Next to it, the "Employee Pulse."

transcript.speaker: David (Design)
transcript.text: This is the aggregation of the weekly surveys. It’s a donut chart breaking down sentiment: Very Satisfied, Satisfied, Neutral, Unsatisfied.

transcript.speaker: Mike (Eng)
transcript.text: Just a UI note here—the legend is below the chart. Do we need that to be interactive? Like, if I click "Very Satisfied," does the chart filter?

transcript.speaker: David (Design)
transcript.text: No, static for MVP. Just color-coded. Blue for "Very Satisfied," Green for "Satisfied," Orange for "Neutral," Red for "Unsatisfied."

transcript.speaker: Sarah (PM)
transcript.text: Finally, the "Latest Announcements" section at the bottom. This is crucial for HR.

transcript.speaker: Mike (Eng)
transcript.text: I see we have tags here: General, HR, IT. Are these hardcoded or dynamic?

transcript.speaker: David (Design)
transcript.text: Dynamic categories. The pills need to map to specific colors. Grey for General, Pink for HR, Light Blue for IT.

transcript.speaker: Mike (Eng)
transcript.text: And the interaction? The arrow on the right suggests the whole row is clickable?

transcript.speaker: David (Design)
transcript.text: Yes, clicking the row or the arrow takes them to the full announcement detail page.

transcript.speaker: Sarah (PM)
transcript.text: Looks solid. Mike, any blockers on the top-right user profile or the search bar?

transcript.speaker: Mike (Eng)
transcript.text: The search bar says "Search anything..."—that implies a global search across Directory, Documents, and Announcements. That’s a heavy lift. Can we scope that to just "Directory" for Sprint 1?

transcript.speaker: Sarah (PM)
transcript.text: Let’s keep the UI as "Search anything" but prioritize Directory and Document results first. Oh, and I see Alex Morgan's profile picture—ensure we have a fallback if the user hasn't uploaded a photo.

transcript.speaker: Mike (Eng)
transcript.text: Will do. I'll scaffold the layout based on this today.
